title: Brits aboard fuel Eurostar
text:
Brits aboard fuel Eurostar Brits aboard fuel Eurostar EUROSTAR carried a record 2.8 million passengers over the past quarter, up 3 per cent on 2014, as a strong pound and a new service to the South of France boosted demand from British holidaymakers. PUBLISHED: 21:51, Tue, Jul 21, 2015 | UPDATED: 21:54, Tue, Jul 21, 2015 AFP Eurostar carried a record 2.8 million passengers over the past quarter 
There was also a healthy increase in use of the high-speed rail service by business travellers on both sides of the Channel, with premier business passenger numbers up 10 per cent on the same period last year. 
The value of overall ticket bookings in the second quarter rose by 1.5 per cent to £232million but sales revenue for the first half was down 2 per cent due to the impact of the Paris terrorist attacks and a fi re in the tunnel. Eurostar’s direct service launched in May between London and Lyon, Avignon and Marseille has sold more than 88,000 tickets. Related articles
